title: Ruwanwelisaya Stupa - The Great Stupa
summary: Magnificent Buddhist stupa built in 140 BCE, one of the world's most sacred monuments

content.text: The Ruwanwelisaya is a stupa in Anuradhapura, Sri Lanka, considered a marvel of ancient engineering and a masterpiece of Buddhist architecture. Built by King Dutugemunu in 140 BCE, it stands as one of the tallest ancient monuments in the world and remains an active place of worship.

content.caption: The magnificent white dome of Ruwanwelisaya against the Sri Lankan sky

content.text: The stupa measures 103 meters (338 feet) in height with a circumference of 290 meters (951 feet). Its perfect hemispherical shape represents the bubble-like nature of existence in Buddhist philosophy. The construction used over 1.8 million baked bricks and features elaborate stone carvings, moonstones, and guard stones.
The Ruwanwelisaya is not just a monument; it is a living testament to the devotion and engineering prowess of ancient Sri Lanka.
content.author: Dr. Senaka Bandaranayake, Archaeologist
